text: pre-2008 Jaguars with more than two
doors looked as British as Highclere
Castle and then XF arrived crisp and
contemporary it left out to become
Jaguars best-selling car obviously the
company didn't take this new one lightly
though in way they did Ford used to own
Jaguar and the first generation XF was
built on a platform from the blue oval
folks the second generation rides on a
fully modern architecture largely built
from bonded and riveted aluminum on
average it's 200 pounds lighter the body
drawn up by the legendary Ian Callum is
quietly urbane less emotional by a
whisker this time around it's a touch
lower and shorter now though the
wheelbase is stretched by a couple
inches this three litre supercharged v6
is bestowed with 340 horsepower go with
the S model for 380 XF literally pulses
with excitement
there's a lot to watch it start up it is
oh so dramatic
this car is rear drive all wheel drive
is available XF runs exclusively with an
8-speed automatic in the US
sorry manual lovers go with pre-mapped
performance settings or get creative the
adjustable suspension is one of the few
options on this test car even with the
less powerful engine
the Jag does not disappoint oh I do like
that lots of deep rich torque off the
line zero to sixty clocks in at just
over six seconds
it seems quicker this cat runs against
out ea6 BMW 5-series cadillac cts and
mercedes e-class
xf has its own feel softer on its feet
with a touch of body roll in a good way
never harsh it eats corners up the
weight distribution is 50/50 this car is
an awful lot of fun to drive comparing
very well with the three Germans act of
the bunch I would say this one is the
party animal as it were driving dynamics
are well balanced scrubbing off speed is
not an issue no it didn't stall
gasps saving engine start/stop systems
are becoming commonplace EPA rated at 20
city 30 highway fuel economy is
reasonable for a luxo performance sedan
though it does want the premium stuff
tech includes a driver and drowsiness
alert system it's not the kind of car
that's going to put anybody to sleep no
also available is semi-autonomous
parking auto braking and adaptive cruise
together with GPS and cameras that read
speed limit signs the Jag can adjust its
speed automatically making it to speed
trap resistant like the exterior the
cockpit design doesn't shout the -
suddenly wraps around the occupants
materials and craftsmanship quietly
convey money bigger drivers will like
the seat bolstering smaller ones might
rattle around during harsh Anakin's the
laser projection head-up display is
noticeably crisp an optional interface
buys a larger touchscreen and replaces
the gauges with a configurable screen
hey jag engineers have you considered
switching the memory and window controls
some drivers might find the pedals too
close together back here there's a nice
amount of room the cushions are angled
upward good for supporting the legs and
thighs the space is noticeably larger
than the outgoing car - will be quite
